snippet: Analysts pointed to Google’s mobile business as a weakness because consumers are rapidly shifting from computer use to mobile devices.
abstract: Google reports first-quarter net income of $3.35 billion, or $9.94 a share, up 16 percent from same period year earlier, largely on strength of core search operations; net revenue was $11.01 billion, up from $8.14 billion; results narrowly meet analyst expectations; company plays up its investments in innovative technology like Google Glass project as it attempts to reassure investors.
lead_paragraph: Analysts pointed to Google’s mobile business as a weakness because consumers are rapidly shifting from computer use to mobile devices.

headline.main: Google, Soothing Investors, Plays Up Its Innovations
headline.print_headline: Google, Soothing Investors, Plays Up Its Innovations
